alert.note: Alert for Inland Jefferson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Jefferson, Cook, southeastern Grady, southern Berrien, northwestern Lanier, northwestern Lowndes, Thomas, Brooks, eastern Colquitt and south central Tift Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered 9 miles southeast of Norman Park, or 9 miles east of Moultrie, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nashville, Adel, Valdosta, Thomasville, Quitman, Moultrie, Hahira, Sparks, Boston, Omega, Ray City, Norman Park, Lenox, Pavo, Coolidge, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Morven and Berlin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
